# kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Core Foundation ](/documentation/corefoundation)

- [ kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack ](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack)

-  kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack 

Global Variable# kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack

iOSiPadOSMac CatalystmacOStvOSvisionOSwatchOS

```
var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack: CFOptionFlags { get }
```

## [Discussion](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack#Discussion)

When enabled using [`CFSocketSetSocketFlags(_:_:)`](/documentation/corefoundation/cfsocketsetsocketflags(_:_:)), the data callback is called every time the socket has read some data. When disabled, the data callback is called only once the next time data are read. The data callback is automatically reenabled by default.

## [See Also](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack#see-also)

### [Constants](/documentation/CoreFoundation/kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableDataCallBack#Constants)

[`var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableReadCallBack: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketautomaticallyreenablereadcallback)[`var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableAcceptCallBack: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketautomaticallyreenableacceptcallback)[`var kCFSocketAutomaticallyReenableWriteCallBack: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketautomaticallyreenablewritecallback)[`var kCFSocketLeaveErrors: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketleaveerrors)[`var kCFSocketCloseOnInvalidate: CFOptionFlags`](/documentation/corefoundation/kcfsocketcloseoninvalidate)When enabled using [`CFSocketSetSocketFlags(_:_:)`](/documentation/corefoundation/cfsocketsetsocketflags(_:_:)), the native socket associated with a CFSocket object is closed when the CFSocket object is invalidated. When disabled, the native socket remains open. This option is enabled by default.
